website_summaries.verdict: A bike attachment that lets you safely bike with your dog. Brings health benefits to you and your dog as you pedal and jog side by side.
pros: Heavy-duty steel spring sits low on arm to absorb 90% force of dog's unexpected pulls
Lets you keep both hands on the handle-bars at all times
Works on most regular, touring, and mountain bikes
Use on left or right side of bike
cons: Before buying, be sure you have a 3-to-4-inch vertical bar on bike in place so it doesn't interfere with peddling
Bolts may not tighten enough and may have to be re-tightened with use
Not good for dogs that like to pull a lot

customer_reviews.title: Sending it back!!!
customer_reviews.text: If o could give it no stars I would. No matter what it swivels, my dog is very obedient but this always swiveling just confuses him. Sending it back!!!!
customer_reviews.author: tay

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Not what I expected for that amount of money, actually cheap made
customer_reviews.author: nice/ice

customer_reviews.title: Broke first time out!
customer_reviews.text: It broke the first time out! Good thing I had my dog leashed as well or she would have been gone.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie Westman

customer_reviews.title: Great way to Run your Dog.
customer_reviews.text: I have a 2 1/2 year old , 70 lb Dalmatian who has a lot of energy. I have never been able to run fast enough to give him the workout that he needs. I attached this to my mountain bike and problem solved. Tips: I wanted a little more room, so I added an 18" Shock Absorbing Lead Extender to the end of the rope attachment.  I clip the leat to the BARKBAY No Pull Dog Harness  I clip his normal dog leash to his collar so I can help him turn when needed.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Colwell

customer_reviews.title: Whole lot of fun
customer_reviews.text: I just got this today. I am non-technical but managed to fit this on my bike fine. I recommend ordering a 13mm wrench off amazon so you are all prepared. I have gone for two short rides with my dog so far. So far so good. The rope it came with is not long enough and I need a longer rope. Also, I think we need to get used to it as he did chase a squirrel and I nearly came off my bike, but I think we will be able to work on that.
customer_reviews.author: H. W.

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed.
customer_reviews.text: I have a Canondale Trail Bike S. Fit perfectly under my seat. Easy to install. I was very skeptical when I saw the white attachment with the four holes, that's why i attached a short double clip leash as an emergency. I'm very glad I did. The second time I went out for a bike ride with my 65 pound labrador it broke, when she saw another dog she really wanted to meet. Like I said, luckily I had my emergency leash on, otherwise, she would have been gone. I only gave it 2 stars because it looks otherwise durable, but way too overpriced for the quality.
customer_reviews.author: RJT

customer_reviews.title: No Manual Included and Can't Seem to Install Correctly as a Result
customer_reviews.text: No manual included and the website provided is in Swedish, which also had no instructions. This bike attachment is more expensive than many others on here listed. Unacceptable to not include instructions. It continues to slide out of place whenever my dog pulls and I'm unsure if it's because I installed it incorrectly or not. I tightened it as much as I could with a crescent wrench.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis E. Brown

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING
customer_reviews.text: Took it out today for the first time with my 40lb dog! She pulls on leash sometimes...did AMAZING with this! I did get the Yangbaga dog shock absorber attachment as recommended by someone else and it was worth it! Also had the front range harness from ruffwear! She took right to it and we had so much fun! She is passed out now! Instructions suck! I read reviews to get the thing on and needed a wrench to tighten all the way. It could stand to be a little tighter but didn't move while riding! I have a women's cannondale hybrid bike and used the red and white spacers to attach under my bike seat. Would 10/10 recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Brachtenbach

customer_reviews.title: The apparatus is good quality and attached easily to the bike. It was my dog that didn’t “work.”
customer_reviews.text: This did not work with my Saluki. I think it is better for labs or almost any other breed except for sighthounds. Sighthounds want to chase AFTER something instead of just running alongside you. Probably good for sled dogs
customer_reviews.author: kberly

customer_reviews.title: My bike also doesn't have a good place to grasp
customer_reviews.text: My dog LOVES the Springer. But keep the tools on hand, he knocks the screws a little loose every now and again. My bike also doesn't have a good place to grasp, so my ankle hits it if I place my ball of my foot on the pedal. I have to pedal with my left foot more forward than I like, but hey...not too shabby for riding around my neighborhood getting some running in.
customer_reviews.author: K. Hearne

customer_reviews.title: Totally Enjoyable
customer_reviews.text: I've tried another similar product. I was average in that it wanted to spin on the mount and the design was straight out. What I like about The Springer is that my German Shepard trots along perfect and when she pulls in any direction the low center of gravity design of The Springer transfers the force very low and I barely notice the pull.
customer_reviews.author: Richard S.

customer_reviews.title: This works well for tall people.
customer_reviews.text: I am 4'7" and could not ride my bike with this on. It made my seat too high and would have been dangerous. There was no other attachment points either. I just went with a bike tow leash. It works with my bike much better.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla Tossone

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I have used this for a year now and love it. If the dog pulls hard enough and your seat isn't tight enough, you can get a little movement from side to side. That said, the spring really takes the brunt of the pulling. Luckily I haven't had to test the fail safe break away part, but everything else works really well.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: instal issue
customer_reviews.text: considering this the only biking tool that is allowed to bike your dog with when earning a title of AD it was a little difficult to understand the directions. it isnt perfect and no matter how tight you tighten it, it moves. I love it dont get me wrong, but it needs improvement.
customer_reviews.author: Canine

customer_reviews.title: This is one of my top 10 dog things to have
customer_reviews.text: I owned one over 15 years ago with my first dog - and I just bought one again and still love it as much! I ride with a male 85-90lbs malamute (well-trained) and it works great! I absolutely LOVE it. Way easier to tire him out than on a walk, or even a jog. He loves it so much, he howls like mad if I leave on a bike ride without him!!
customer_reviews.author: Veronique Binette

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to exercise our German Shepherd who is very high energy and neither myself nor my husband could walk her fast enough. He didn't think it would work, but after taking off the first time she ran along like she had done it forever. They had 2 near wrecks, involving a rabbit then a deer crossing the road in front of them but control was maintained and no one was hurt or even went down. Well worth the money, and our GSD is getting the workout she has needed and really deserved. The Jogger is very well made and I think it will last us the lifetime of our dog and beyond.
customer_reviews.author: SSaver

customer_reviews.title: Ideal for those of us who have high energy dogs and we have bad knees so can't do 'walks'
customer_reviews.text: works just like all the videos show. Also the quick emergency release works too, had to use it on first ride....dog got spooked and she went on one side of mailbox and I went on the other. So glad I got this exerciser, the spring is ideal when she pulls, I can't feel it on my bike at all.
customer_reviews.author: Lori Thoelke

customer_reviews.title: A Gift from Heaven.
customer_reviews.text: Works great, could use a little better system like some rubber incorporated in or placed between the plastic seatpost tube sleeves for friction to prevent sliding, but still 5 stars because its manageable if you get tightened correctly and works better than anything else I have seen on the market. My Bluetick Coonhound is having all of his at least 4 miles a day needs met with so much time saved!!!
customer_reviews.author: Deitrich J Thompson

customer_reviews.title: would not recommend.
customer_reviews.text: I have to modify to make it work... would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Survivor dude

customer_reviews.title: Love it. Expensive but worth it.
customer_reviews.text: I love this device! I also bought the xtra arm since I have two dogs. All three of us have only been out once, but it was awesome! They pulled but I didn’t feel it at all. I can finally outrun them! Installation was a little tricky because I had to improvise since it didn’t fit my bike, but I did get it secure.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle S.

customer_reviews.title: This is such a great idea and I sooo wanted it to work for ...
customer_reviews.text: This is such a great idea and I sooo wanted it to work for us... I'm a shorty and my bike seat was too low to put it on the stem. Having it below made my foot hit it every time -ouch 😖 Too bad... Just for the info...my bike is a step-thru mountain bike.
customer_reviews.author: DM

customer_reviews.title: My husky loves it!
customer_reviews.text: After reading reviews from other people I was a little hesitant about the install, I was nice and surprised that it wasn't as complicated. Plus it feels good at the end of the day after taking her on a nice run with the bike I know she has truly gotten a good work out.
customer_reviews.author: Sha sha

customer_reviews.title: Will work great as long as there is room for the mounting bracket
customer_reviews.text: This a well made product and will work great, as long as your seat post or seat stay has room for the clamp. Unfortunately my wife's bike is a full suspension MTB plus her seatpost doesn't have enough room unless I raised it over 1 inch, meaning she couldn't reach the pedals so I had to return it.
customer_reviews.author: MB McCutcheon

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for Siberian Husky
customer_reviews.text: Awesome! I use this on my Siberian Husky mix who loves to pull and jump at squirrels. The spring really does absorb the shock and I can get him tired out quickly with this. Lifesaver!
customer_reviews.author: LJ777

customer_reviews.title: So easy to install and use and she can just pull ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a godsend! I have a husky and she loves to run. So easy to install and use and she can just pull all she wants and it doesn’t pull the bike over
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey Deaton

customer_reviews.title: Our pup loves it
customer_reviews.text: Great way to exercise our newly adopted Border Collie mix. I was worried she would be able to pull me over! But we have gone for about 10 rides now and even when she pulls sideways after a major distraction I have not lost my balance. We are purchasing a harness though so she does not pull on her collar.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: FUN, And exercise
customer_reviews.text: Fun fun fun, who needs a electric bike when you have one of these and a dog, straight up the hills we go, you will need to teach you dog a "SLOW" command
customer_reviews.author: L Davis

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: We use it at least once a week to give our dog time to run, it's very sturdy and such a great way to spend time with your pet while both getting a workout.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Foot hits bar when peddling
customer_reviews.text: Nice product, have friends who love it that is why I bought BUT when I peddle my heel hits the springer every go around 🤬 I am a woman size 6 shoe, if I was able to return I would
customer_reviews.author: Patti K

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Great device for my dog and me to exercise together.
customer_reviews.author: Bryce3333

customer_reviews.title: ... a hard time in the beginning but is running like a champ
customer_reviews.text: Okay so he had a hard time in the beginning but is running like a champ.
customer_reviews.author: Tami Dyer

customer_reviews.title: Great product! Worth the $$$!
customer_reviews.text: Love this product! It's made of very high quality materials and is relatively easy to put together. My young husky found it very easy to learn how to use it and loves when we go out on it! I highly recommend this to anyone with a dog who loves to run and/or pull!
customer_reviews.author: Merri

customer_reviews.title: Strong enough for shepherd puppy.
customer_reviews.text: I am an older person with a six month old Shepherd puppy. I cannot wear this puppy out by walking her. I take her on runs with my bike now and she is worn out in 15 mins. This device works extremely well! The puppy weighs around 70 pounds and reacts to things like other dogs and squirrels. The spring works!
customer_reviews.author: ELLEN

customer_reviews.title: Life Changer
customer_reviews.text: Amazing workout in a matter of minutes. My American bulldog pulls my husband at warp speed and my Frenchie is an animal.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Sparks

customer_reviews.title: Great way to excerise my dog!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and works well. I wish the cord that comes with it was a bit longer for my smaller dog. I just made one that was 2” longer so my small dog could exercise too.
customer_reviews.author: J@ke

customer_reviews.title: it is currently bent in half from a dog running ...
customer_reviews.text: it is currently bent in half from a dog running around a post and getting caught up going slow over a bridge
customer_reviews.author: Cleetis

customer_reviews.title: Great if you solve spinning seat post problem
customer_reviews.text: Springer tends to spin on the seat post. Springer is high quality and works well; able to peddle normally.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Didn't fit on multiple bikes
customer_reviews.text: This seemed like a great idea and I thought I did my research before purchasing this product but it didn't fit on my bike or my boyfriends bikes. Seller never responded to my request to return. Thankfully I purchased through Amazon who helped me receive a full refund. Great idea but wouldn't use this company.
customer_reviews.author: mtngurl

customer_reviews.title: The best bike leash
customer_reviews.text: My neighbor let me borrow his and I had to get one for myself. Arrived yesterday, and got it installed. Dogs are super excited.
customer_reviews.author: angelfire

customer_reviews.title: Springer is by far the best designed bicycle jogger
customer_reviews.text: This is not my first Springer, but in my experience, it is by far the most effective bike jogger.
customer_reviews.author: Erika N. Wyatt

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Actually put 2 large dogs on this without trouble! 2 large shepards 140 lbs in total. NO PULL!!!
customer_reviews.author: Betty

customer_reviews.title: Hands free dog exercise
customer_reviews.text: Our pointer breed (Vizsla) needs a LOT of exercise. Jogging with him never gets him tired. And taking him by leash alongside the bike was also a problem, because he would pull ahead of the bike. The Springer bicycle jogger has been a great solution. Owner and dog get good exercise, and dog gets tired.
customer_reviews.author: Goober

customer_reviews.title: JUNK
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't fit the seat post like it says it will doesn't fit bike with arm as pictured --Very loose on seat post spins around no matter what and arm hits when bike is pedaled when in position as pictured This thing is junk not worth purchase at all
customer_reviews.author: Catherine G.

customer_reviews.title: Loved it. does shift around a lot no matter ...
customer_reviews.text: Loved it. does shift around a lot no matter how much you tighten it
customer_reviews.author: Brittiany Fitzgerald

customer_reviews.title: great for me AND the doggie!
customer_reviews.text: My giant puppy loves to hunt for lizards while we take our walks every day. Sometimes, we just have to get the walk done without regard to stopping to smell the lizards. On those days, and when she has lots of extra energy, this springer thing is the bomb. This contraption works great. I let her set the pace - sometimes we trot around our usual half hour walk, and it takes just 10 minutes with me pedaling and her trotting. Sometimes, she's feeling it, and she gallops for a mile or two. It's a great change-up to our normal routine, and an excellent accelerated doggie exercise device for when I'm running late. A fantastic product.
customer_reviews.author: paul f stone

customer_reviews.title: Works really well. Keeps my dog a safe distance ...
customer_reviews.text: Works really well. Keeps my dog a safe distance away and is well-built so should last a long time. It does move forward or backward if the dog tugs hard, no matter how tight you make it, otherwise it would get 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love this unit
customer_reviews.text: I love this unit. My boxer and I move along at 6mph. He is 75lbs of solid muscle and he can't pull me down. The main mount attaches to the seat post which is your center of gravity. The spring absorbs any sudden jerk or tug from him. Further, should you want to take the unit off your bike and just go riding... no problem. It disconnects by pulling out one single pin. Very user friendly.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas E. Wright

customer_reviews.title: Didnt tighen on the bike frame enough
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to exercise my pitbull. It installed easily. Does not tighten on the frame enough for a strong puller.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie

customer_reviews.title: You need space
customer_reviews.text: Can only use on bikes with enough room between bar and the seat. I purchased and didn’t have enough inches in between to make it work. Wish I knew before purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: rebecca

customer_reviews.title: A lifesaver with active dogs
customer_reviews.text: One connector (the three plastic pieces failed after several uses) but it was simple to discard those pieces and make a modification. I have an 11 month old Great Pyrenees puppy that we currently exercise with our bicycle
customer_reviews.author: Christina M. Jinnett

customer_reviews.title: It performs beautifully, and my dogs are loving the exercise
customer_reviews.text: Ingenious design. I have dogs with high prey drive, so was a bit worried about using this. It performs beautifully, and my dogs are loving the exercise!
customer_reviews.author: laurasnowbird

customer_reviews.title: Too many parts and poor design.
customer_reviews.text: This item doesn't provide a clear leg cycling path once installed. Size and positioning made my dog anxious and nervous. Wouldn't recommend this item for those reasons.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor instructions
customer_reviews.text: The product directions are not clear. Plus they did not send me a needed bolt that was needed to secure the product , I went and bought one . Would I purchase this product again.:NO.
customer_reviews.author: Carie

customer_reviews.title: Every dog owner should have one. First couple time ...
customer_reviews.text: Every dog owner should have one. First couple time are strange for you and the dog. Then it is one of those why didn't i have a springer before. The dog loves it and so do I. Just don't run your dog too far in the beginning.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: I love this product
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. My dog tugs A LOT but I barely feel it and am able to keep control. Good investment.
customer_reviews.author: H. S.

customer_reviews.title: Best thing EVER
customer_reviews.text: Best thing EVER !!!!! You can bike with your dog and not worry about dogs safety since it keeps him at good distance from your bike. Love it !
customer_reviews.author: anna resulovic

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using one of these for years. Forget the plastic safety clip and use a metal carbeaner. My dog weighs 65-70lbs and is sure he can catch a squirrel and dump me off the bike....not happening. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Miriam Weiner

customer_reviews.title: I mounted this on recumbent trike and it is perfect for my one year old Golden Retriever which is ...
customer_reviews.text: I mounted this on recumbent trike and it is perfect for my one year old Golden Retriever which is attached by a simple harness and pulls me as he trots along for a mile or so. Great product!!
customer_reviews.author: Mac

customer_reviews.title: Shockingly durable
customer_reviews.text: I didn't want to believe it could work with how hard my dog pulls, but it has yet to fail me once!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: City Husky Happiness
customer_reviews.text: My city husky took to this like she was born to mush well in the city!! Great stable product!!! Easy to assemble. Make sure you have two 1/2" sockets! She felt secure on it and is a great height.
customer_reviews.author: Shoppin' Mom

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. Our Mini husky loves it
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Our Mini husky loves it . She was a little worried at the beginning and she is starting getting used too. Great product .
customer_reviews.author: AnMa

customer_reviews.title: once you're set up and your dog is accustomed to ...
customer_reviews.text: once you're set up and your dog is accustomed to the product, it's a big plus for the dog (and the owner). lots of healthy exercise in a short amount of time.
customer_reviews.author: John Steele

customer_reviews.title: Needs work
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad product overall. Had to make some improvents. On the loop there is a small opening that i welded. The seat atachment would move back and foward if my dog pulls hard. Made a hole and put a bolt thru problem solved. My APBT got loose twice. Luckly nothing wrong happened.
customer_reviews.author: joam

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Great item for exercising our large dog. At 70 lbs can't feel any pulling. Don't be fooled by cheaper products in the retail market. The Springer is built to last and is worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install. Only took about a week to train and now he loves it! Comfortable for him, easy for me!
customer_reviews.author: Alissyn

customer_reviews.title: Our Favorite New Toy!!!
customer_reviews.text: My 2 dogs and I compete in agility and this is the perfect way to keep them in shape. I take spin classes at my local fitness club then I come home and take them, one at a time, for a workout as well. I pedal at a slow enough speed to cool me down from my spin class but fast enough to give them a nice jog. I would certainly always use a halter for my dog(s) because a leash attached to a collar would be very dangerous to any dog.
customer_reviews.author: Janae

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Dog needs to be trained to walk along side of bike
customer_reviews.author: Lydia Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Springer Jogger
customer_reviews.text: The rope was cheap and the clasp was made of a cheap plastic. I ended up going to a hardware store and purchasing a metal clasp to attach to the dog collar. Also, it fit on one of our bikes, and not on the other. They should provide longer installation bolts that fit any size bike.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas H Poole

customer_reviews.title: Only okay
customer_reviews.text: The design of this bike leash is great and the quality is quite good. My issue was the stability of the leash where it attached to my bike. My little 6 month old puppy could make it slide at the attachment. It seems to me that they should add something rubber instead of plastic to build up a bikes tub to achieve the correct diameter for the attachment.
customer_reviews.author: Candace L. Kahn

customer_reviews.title: Good product. Super easy to install.
customer_reviews.text: This product is well designed and well made. It was easy to install and absorbs any impulses from my 60 lb. dog to make a quick detour. My only issue is that, after making every possible adjustment, my heel still slightly bumps it with each peddle. It's just a bit annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Delena McLaughlin

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great item for walking the dog. Durable. Easy to use. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great with my dog
customer_reviews.text: I like everything about it the mounting part seems to work itself Loose a little bit
customer_reviews.author: Kent Nuttall

customer_reviews.title: Springer Bicycle Jogger
customer_reviews.text: This had to be cut down to fit my bike, which is an ordinary women's Schwinn. The clasp attaching it to the bike does not fit tightly enough to keep it from turning, so it does not remain perpendicular to bike. I have to have my heel on the pedal to keep from hitting it. Next time I will buy a Walky-dog.
customer_reviews.author: C Craig

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This allows us to exercise our dogs, Urban and Woody, Shetland Sheepdogs.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck Schierbeck

customer_reviews.title: But the dogs love them.
customer_reviews.text: It works as advertised. Because of placement of the mounting apparatus and the height of our dogs we needed to lengthen the leads. But the dogs love them.
customer_reviews.author: Scott VanGuilder

customer_reviews.title: Durability
customer_reviews.text: I tether my husky to my bike to ride safely on trails.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Ann Harvey

customer_reviews.title: I is not strong enough for my Lab
customer_reviews.text: I cant be tightened enough to ride with my large Lab.
customer_reviews.author: Ann

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for me...
customer_reviews.text: had to return mine because my bike's style wouldn't work with the shape of the singer without my pedal hitting it (or my rear basket or bottle carrier getting in the way) Also, the instructions were translated from another language, so maybe the bikes in that country have different types of bikes... whatever the reason, the clasp (though it came with three adjustable sizes) wouldn't stay in place when i did try to attach it to one of the bars on my bike :( I decided to go with the Walky Dog, which is AWESOME and fit my bike (and my jack russell) perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Vicky

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My husky loves this ... so do I .. we both get quality time and exercise ....
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love this for my husky Akita mix! It's easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Maggie K.

customer_reviews.title: happy dog
customer_reviews.text: Now my dog can really run fast and still be safe because I am in control.I still need to buy her a halter to go with the Springer. The tug on her collar looks very uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Shelley A. Burns

customer_reviews.title: Your dog will love it....
customer_reviews.text: Works great, if you have a high energy dog, you will have fun with this. Let the dog set the pace and enjoy.
customer_reviews.author: J n P

customer_reviews.title: Happy dog, happy life
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm, I'm now able give my over energetic dog the exercise she needs while also keeping her at a safe distance from my bike
customer_reviews.author: Brisa Castillo

customer_reviews.title: Not for al bikes
customer_reviews.text: I am only 4'10" with a bike tailored to my height. Could not mount the jogger high enough to allow my foot to come through without hitting the jogger bar.
customer_reviews.author: Virginia Sanford

customer_reviews.title: We received the Springer Bicycle Jogger but have not attached ...
customer_reviews.text: We received the Springer Bicycle Jogger but have not attached it as of yet. Friends have had one several years and use it frequently and really appreciate it.
customer_reviews.author: Carol J. Sabrowsky

customer_reviews.title: Great for you and your dog!
customer_reviews.text: If you have an active dog and you like to ride a bike, this is the ticket for you and your dog. Both of you will get fit and have alot of fun doing it. I use to run my dog with a leash on my bike and we crashed a couple of times. Never again, with the springer you have both hands on the handle bars and your dog is secure by your side. Have fun Tigger and I sure do. Take care Scott
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Works good. Wish it had an extra bracket for another ...
customer_reviews.text: Works good. Wish it had an extra bracket for another bike.
customer_reviews.author: AW

customer_reviews.title: It is great. Both of our dogs love it when we ...
customer_reviews.text: It is great. Both of our dogs love it when we pull the bikes out... they know that it is time for a jog. Easy to mount and train the dog/ rider.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE it! We had to hook it to the front because of half bike but it works really well! Bike remains steady even if he tugs!
customer_reviews.author: N P

customer_reviews.title: Great accessory
customer_reviews.text: GREAT tool, dog loves it. Obviously the rider NEEDS to be very careful and keep a look out for the dog the ENTIRE ride to make sure the dog doesn't come too close to the bike. The quality of this product is EXCELLENT! Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Boomer

customer_reviews.title: Don't Be Fooled
customer_reviews.text: I've found no effort necessary, as my dog pulls me everywhere. The jogger performs as advertised, even absorbing lunges toward rabbits without difficulty. My balance on the bike has never been upset, and the dog has no trouble staying clear.
customer_reviews.author: J M Tiberii

customer_reviews.title: Works very well
customer_reviews.text: I use this to exercise my Vizsla. This thing works really well. It twists a little when my dog gets in front but I need to do some more adjusting. This is a high quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I'd highly recommend to a
customer_reviews.text: The Springer works wonders for my huskies! I'd highly recommend to a friend
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Moore

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Nice balance and doesn't pull the bike off balance as one would expect. Dog loves it to because he like the faster pace of his walks.
customer_reviews.author: Tom B Speet

customer_reviews.title: Springer, well built and works!
customer_reviews.text: Very well built, heavy duty. Well packed and works. Just take your time training your dog. My 65 pound puppy needed more exercise than simple walks and doing a couple miles at a brisk pace sure helps create a calmer dog.
customer_reviews.author: James I.

customer_reviews.title: This works great!
customer_reviews.text: We have a boder collie and he needs lots of running. This keep him free of the bicycle and he cannot pull me over when he tries to stop and pee on a tree.
customer_reviews.author: dragonfan

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what we're looking for!
customer_reviews.text: We have a young husky with lots of energy. She instantly fell in love with biking with me. It's a great way to exercise her and keep her safe. The Springer Bicycle Jogger worked exactly as expected.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: 85lb insane lab dane mix
customer_reviews.text: I have an 85lb Lab Dane mix dog that I got from the pound. I got a harness for him and hooked it up. I put on all my motorcycle gear because I was expecting to crash, but guess what, it worked! Dog LOVES it! now he won't stop nudging the bike.
customer_reviews.author: DurhamDude66

customer_reviews.title: An amazing product!
customer_reviews.text: This lead barely pulls the rider even with a 60lbs dog in full run. I have used it now for several weeks. My dog picked it up in no time! I highly recommend a harness with an over the back attachment point if you're buying this product.
customer_reviews.author: Darrell F Lochtefeld

customer_reviews.title: We love our Springer
customer_reviews.text: This has lived up to all the press it has received. I ride with a 70 lb. Siberian Husky and this is the best tool ever.
customer_reviews.author: C. Trowbridge

product_meta.title: Springer Dog Exerciser, Biking with Your Dog
feature_bullets: Springer Leash, the bike attachment that allows you to safely bike with your dog.
This unique dog exerciser can bring health benefits for you and your dog as you pedal and jog side-by-side.
The device has a heavy-duty steel spring, situated low on the arm to absorb up to 90% of the force of a dog¹s unexpected tugs
It does not include a harness. Please use a harness that is suitable for your particular breed. Do not use a regular collar which may injure your dog.
Can be used on either side of your bike
